\displaystyle{T}_{{G}} is the temperature at ground level in Fahrenheit
\displaystyle{A} is the height above ground level in feet
If the temperature on the ground is \displaystyle{45}^{\circ}, what will it be at 5500 feet above ground level?
Answers should be rounded to the units place.

solution.p: The model for this situation is \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={45}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{A}.
Because we want to estimate the temperature at 5500 ft AGL, we calculate \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={45}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{5500}={25.75}\approx{26}
